Pascakebakaran Hutan, Pendakian Gunung Tambora Dibuka
04 Nov 2019, 23:30 by Harianto Nukman


Ilustrasi Gunung Tambora (Taman Nasional Gunung Tambora)

Mataram - Selama hampir lebih dari 2 pekan ditutup pasca kebakaran hutan dan lahan. Kini semua jalur pendakian Gunung Tambora dibuka kembali.Terhitung mulai tanggal 4 November 2019 seluruh pintu pendakian Taman Nasional (TN) Tambora termasuk Gunung Tambora dibuka kembali untuk aktivitas wisata pendakian dan aktivitas lainnya."Sudah dibuka. Ditutup sementara sejak 21 Oktober 2019 yang lalu. Dibuka kembali 4 November 2019, semua jalur," ucap Kepala Balai TN Tambora, Murlan Dameria Pane saat dihubungi Senin (4/11/2019) malam.Kebijakan itu berdasarkan hasil pemantauan kebakaran hutan dan lahan (Karhutla) yang pernah terjadi di kawasan TN Tambora dan sekitarnya. Pantauan melalui aplikasi Lapan Fire Hotspot dan dipadu dengan hasil pengamatan lapangan (ground check) turut menjadi pertimbangan tersebut."Ya, berdasarkan data Lapan Fire Hotspot dan groundcheck lapangan sudah kondusif untuk pendakian. Beberapa hari ini juga sudah mulai turun hujan dan angin tidak kencang," jelas Murlan."Hujan saat ini intensitasnya tidak besar. Kondisi alam tetap kami pantau. Dibuka jalur pendakian melalui Pancasila, Kawinda Toi, Piong dan Doroncanga," imbuhnya.Para pelaku usaha wisata dan wisatawan yang akan melakukan aktivitas di TN Tambora diharapkan Murlan agar melapor kepada petugas.Pendaki juga diimbau melakukan registrasi di setiap pintu masuk jalur pendakian serta membayar tiket masuk TN Tambora sesuai ketetapan yang telah ditetapkan pemerintah.Selain itu, pendaki juga harus menjaga kebersihan kawasan, ketertiban, keamanan, dan kenyamanan wisatawan.Kelestarian kawasan dengan harus diperhatikan dengan tidak menebang pohon, ranting, vandalisme atau kegiatan lain yang dapat mengganggu ekosistem di TN Tambora. After the Forest Fire, Mount Tambora Climb Opened
Nov 04 2019, 23:30 by Harianto Nukman


Illustration of Mount Tambora (Mount Tambora National Park)

Mataram - For nearly more than 2 weeks it was closed after forest and land fires. Now all the climbing routes of Mount Tambora are reopened. Counting starting November 4, 2019 all the climbing gates of the Tambora National Park (TN) including Mount Tambora have been reopened for climbing tourism activities and other activities. "It has been opened. It was temporarily closed since October 21, 2019 ago. November 4, 2019 reopened, all lines, "said Head of Tambora NP National Park, Murlan Dameria Pane when contacted on Monday night (4/11/2019). The policy was based on the results of forest and land fire monitoring (Karhutla) that had occurred in the Tambora NP area and surrounding. Monitoring through the Lapan Fire Hotspot application and combined with the results of field observations (ground check) is also a consideration. "Yes, based on data from the Lapan Fire Hotspot and groundcheck the field is conducive to climbing. Some days it has also started raining and the wind is not strong, "explained Murlan." Rain is currently not of great intensity. We continue to monitor natural conditions. Opened hiking routes through Pancasila, Kawinda Toi, Piong and Doroncanga, "he added. The tour operators and tourists who will carry out activities in Tambora NP are expected to Murlan report to the officer. The desire is also advised to register at each entrance of the hiking trail and pay the entrance fee of Tambora National Park in accordance with the provisions set by the government. In addition, climbers must also maintain the cleanliness of the area, order, security, and comfort of tourists. pay attention not to cut down trees, twigs, vandalism or other activities in which can disturb the ecosystem in Tambora National Park.
